entry.title: Adding New BIP Editors
entry.summary:
The discussion revolves around the criteria necessary for someone to assume the role of a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) editor. Michael Folkson addresses the qualities that are deemed essential for a BIP editor, highlighting that while being highly intelligent or familiar with Bitcoin is valuable, these characteristics alone do not qualify someone for the editorial position. The emphasis is placed on specific skills and attributes that are critical for the job.
Firstly, it is pointed out that candidates for the BIP editor position must possess more than just a deep understanding of Bitcoin. The field contains numerous individuals who meet this requirement, suggesting that knowledge of Bitcoin, while necessary, is not a sufficient criterion for selection. Instead, the focus shifts towards other crucial competencies that are vital for a BIP editor.
The primary qualifications for a BIP editor include demonstrated expertise in copy-editing, a lengthy and proven involvement in the Bitcoin community, and the ability to be consistently available. These criteria suggest that the role demands a high level of precision in editing, a comprehensive history of contributions to Bitcoin, and a commitment to being reliably accessible. Such specifications underscore the professional and dedicated nature of the role, indicating that the ideal candidate must bring a blend of editorial skill, extensive experience, and dependable engagement to the position.
